Articles.Content:
![CZGPEGN.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/CZGPEGN.jpg)

Running the throttle at 25% on the LV-909 means that ore extraction and ISRU conversation and fuel consumption are in balance. You can run the engine for as long as the ore lasts, which with a class C is a very long time. 

I started burning with an intercepting class C well out from Kerbin and made an orbit after an hour or so.

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/ozw9n81cj9hemiw/Mini%20miner%20pusher%201.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/ozw9n81cj9hemiw/Mini%20miner%20pusher%201.craft?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-02T14:33:29Z" title="05/02/2015 02:33  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 2, 2015</time> by Foxster**
Genius idea, will have to try out! Have some rep!

Cool idea indeed ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

But I'm not sure I could take an hour of orbital adjustment xD
Well you could do a compromise. Take a bigger ship and use the asteroid to top off the tanks.

This seems like a brilliant idea, until one realizes the risk of getting back to Kerbin with an empty asteroid xD

Okay, it's still pretty smart. I'll have to keep this in mind for whenever I get around to upgrading the Tracking Station.
Well, I've just made a 150K round orbit and the asteroid resources are at 82%. So not too bad.
